intro: Sinoradlkofera minor, commonly known as the lesser radlkofera, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, often found in undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
